exercises.name: Gentle Neck Rolls
exercises.description: Slowly roll your head in a circular motion to release neck tension from sitting.
exercises.cue: Drop your chin to chest, then slowly roll your head to one shoulder, back, other shoulder, and return. Keep movements slow and controlled.
exercises.contraindication: Stop immediately if you feel dizziness, sharp pain, or grinding sensations. Avoid if you have cervical spine issues.

exercises.name: Chin Tucks
exercises.description: Strengthen neck muscles and correct forward head posture from screen time.
exercises.cue: Sit tall, gently pull your chin back (making a double chin). Hold 5 seconds, release. Keep eyes level with the horizon.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you experience pain in neck or head. Not recommended if you have TMJ issues or recent neck injury.

exercises.name: Neck Side Stretch
exercises.description: Gently stretch the muscles along the side of your neck to release tension.
exercises.cue: Tilt your right ear toward right shoulder, gently press with right hand. Hold 15 seconds, switch sides. Keep shoulders relaxed.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel numbness or tingling down your arm. Avoid if you have neck injuries or nerve issues.

exercises.name: Shoulder Shrugs
exercises.description: Release tension built up from hunching over keyboard and mouse.
exercises.cue: Raise shoulders up toward your ears, hold for 3 seconds, then drop them down completely. Feel the tension release.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel sharp pain in shoulders or neck. Avoid aggressive movements if you have rotator cuff issues.

exercises.name: Shoulder Circles
exercises.description: Improve shoulder mobility and blood flow to upper back.
exercises.cue: Roll shoulders forward in big circles 5 times, then backward 5 times. Keep arms relaxed at your sides.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you hear clicking with pain or feel shoulder instability. Reduce range if you have frozen shoulder.

exercises.name: Chest Opener Stretch
exercises.description: Counteract the forward hunch from desk work by opening the chest.
exercises.cue: Clasp hands behind your back, straighten arms, and gently lift while squeezing shoulder blades together. Hold and breathe.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel pain in shoulders or chest. Avoid if you have shoulder impingement or recent chest surgery.

exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.description: Warm up the shoulder joints and improve circulation in the arms.
exercises.cue: Extend arms out to sides. Make small circles, gradually increasing size. 10 forward, 10 backward. Keep core engaged.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel joint pain or instability. Reduce size of circles if you have shoulder issues.

exercises.name: Doorway Chest Stretch
exercises.description: Open up tight chest muscles that pull shoulders forward during desk work.
exercises.cue: Stand in doorway, forearms on frame at 90 degrees. Step one foot forward and lean gently. Hold 20 seconds.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel shoulder pain or pinching. Avoid if you have shoulder instability or recent injury.

exercises.name: Seated Spinal Twist
exercises.description: Gently rotate the spine to relieve back stiffness and improve mobility.
exercises.cue: Sit tall, place right hand on left knee, twist gently to the left. Hold 15 seconds, then switch sides. Keep hips facing forward.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you experience back pain or disc-related symptoms. Avoid deep twisting if you have herniated discs or spinal issues.

exercises.name: Seated Cat-Cow
exercises.description: Mobilize the entire spine with this gentle flowing movement.
exercises.cue: Hands on knees. Inhale: arch back, lift chest (cow). Exhale: round spine, tuck chin (cat). Flow slowly with breath.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel sharp pain in spine. Reduce range of motion if you have lower back issues or disc problems.

exercises.name: Thoracic Extension
exercises.description: Reverse the hunched posture by extending the upper back over the chair.
exercises.cue: Interlace fingers behind head. Lean back over chair top, extending upper back. Hold 10 seconds, return. Repeat 3 times.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel sharp pain or dizziness. Avoid if you have osteoporosis or recent back injury.

exercises.name: Upper Trapezius Stretch
exercises.description: Release the upper trapezius muscles that tense up from desk work stress.
exercises.cue: Sit tall, hold chair seat with right hand. Tilt head left, gently pull with left hand. Hold 20 seconds, switch.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel numbness or sharp pain. Avoid aggressive stretching if you have neck problems.

exercises.name: Seated Pelvic Tilts
exercises.description: Mobilize the lower back and strengthen core muscles while seated.
exercises.cue: Sit at edge of chair. Rock pelvis forward (arching lower back), then rock back (flattening lower back). 10 slow repetitions.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you experience lower back pain. Move within comfortable range if you have disc issues.

exercises.name: Seated Knee to Chest
exercises.description: Gently stretch the lower back and glute muscles.
exercises.cue: Sit back in chair. Lift right knee, clasp hands around shin, pull gently toward chest. Hold 20 seconds, switch.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel hip or knee pain. Avoid if you have hip replacement or acute sciatica.

exercises.name: Wrist Circles
exercises.description: Increase blood flow and mobility in wrists strained from typing.
exercises.cue: Extend arms forward. Make fists and rotate wrists in circles - 10 times each direction. Keep movements smooth.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel pain, numbness, or tingling. Avoid if you have carpal tunnel syndrome flare-up or wrist injury.

exercises.name: Wrist Flexor Stretch
exercises.description: Stretch the forearm muscles that get tight from keyboard use.
exercises.cue: Extend one arm forward, palm up. Use other hand to gently pull fingers down and back. Hold 15 seconds each side.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel sharp pain or numbness radiating up arm. Avoid aggressive stretching with carpal tunnel or tendinitis.

exercises.name: Wrist Extensor Stretch
exercises.description: Stretch the top of the forearm to balance wrist flexibility.
exercises.cue: Extend one arm forward, palm down. Use other hand to gently pull fingers toward you. Hold 15 seconds each side.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel pain or numbness. Avoid aggressive stretching if you have wrist or elbow issues.

exercises.name: Finger Spread and Squeeze
exercises.description: Improve circulation and release tension in hands from mouse and keyboard use.
exercises.cue: Spread fingers wide like a starfish, hold 3 seconds. Make a tight fist, hold 3 seconds. Repeat 10 times.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you experience joint pain. Avoid if you have arthritis flare-up in hands.

exercises.name: Seated Figure-4 Stretch
exercises.description: Open the hips and stretch glutes that get tight from prolonged sitting.
exercises.cue: Cross right ankle over left knee, sit tall. Gently lean forward until you feel a stretch in right hip. Hold 20 seconds, switch.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel knee pain or hip joint pain. Avoid if you have hip replacement or acute hip injury.

exercises.name: Seated Marching
exercises.description: Get blood flowing in your legs and engage hip flexors.
exercises.cue: Sit tall at edge of chair. Alternate lifting knees toward chest in a marching motion. Keep core engaged and back straight.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you experience hip or lower back pain. Avoid high knee lifts if you have hip flexor strain.

exercises.name: Seated Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.description: Stretch the hip flexors that shorten from sitting all day.
exercises.cue: Sit sideways on chair edge, right leg forward. Slide left leg back, keep hips square. Tuck pelvis, lean forward slightly. Hold 20 seconds, switch.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel groin pain or knee discomfort. Avoid if you have hip impingement.

exercises.name: Ankle Circles
exercises.description: Improve ankle mobility and circulation in your lower legs.
exercises.cue: Lift one foot slightly. Draw circles with your toes - 10 each direction. Switch feet and repeat.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel ankle pain or instability. Avoid if you have recent ankle injury.

exercises.name: Standing Side Stretch
exercises.description: Lengthen the side body and stretch muscles compressed from sitting.
exercises.cue: Stand tall, raise right arm overhead. Lean gently to the left, feeling a stretch along right side. Hold 15 seconds, switch.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel dizziness when standing or sharp pain in side. Hold onto desk for balance if needed.

exercises.name: Desk Push-Ups
exercises.description: Strengthen arms, chest, and core while taking a break from sitting.
exercises.cue: Place hands on desk edge, shoulder-width apart. Step back, body straight. Lower chest toward desk, push back up. 10 reps.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel wrist, shoulder, or chest pain. Avoid if you have recent upper body injury or heart conditions.

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises
exercises.description: Activate leg muscles and improve circulation after sitting.
exercises.cue: Stand behind chair for balance. Rise onto tiptoes, hold 2 seconds, lower slowly. Repeat 15 times.
exercises.contraindication: Stop if you feel calf cramping or pain. Hold desk for balance if needed. Avoid if you have Achilles issues.
